*div1 type="summary"* *p*Stephen Holmes to Austin, September 12, 1826. Asking assistance in collection of debt.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Natchitoches */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="09-12-1826">Sept- 12th 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Sir-*/p*
*p*Seven or Eight years ago more or less a man by the name of *person_mentioned*John Robinson*/person_mentioned* commonly called *person_mentioned*Jacky Robinson*/person_mentioned* Bought of *person_mentioned*Msrs- Pavia*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Viann */person_mentioned*of this *location_mentioned*Town */location_mentioned*about four hundred dollars worth of Goods and *person_mentioned*Mr- Placide Bossier*/person_mentioned* was his security and had it to pay and did pay it. Since that in an arrangement of some affairs between *person_mentioned*Mr- Bossier*/person_mentioned*s and myselfe he made over and transferred the demand against *person_mentioned*Robinson */person_mentioned*to me, with all necessary Receipts Vouchers etc—I have lately been informed that *person_mentioned*Robinson */person_mentioned*died somewhere in your *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned*. The Object of this letter is to obtain as a favour from you If *location_mentioned*Robinson*/location_mentioned* is dead and If he left property sufficient to satisfy the above Claim. If you will Answer this letter direct your letter to the Care of *person_mentioned*Doctor Sibley*/person_mentioned* of *location_mentioned*Nachitoches*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen Holmes*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
